channel.title: Homes on Sancar Adali - personal website
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Sancar Adali - personal website

item.description: Biography My resume I am a machine learning researcher at Raytheon BBN Technologies. I have worked on computer vision, bioinformatics and statistical analysis problems. I am interested in different approaches to learning from disparate modalities of data collected from different sensors. I am also interested in applications of data fusion to graphs and in general, learning from graph data. I have a PhD in Applied Mathematics and Statistics from Johns Hopkins University.

item.title: Software
item.description: RGraphM is a graph matching R package based on [graphm]http://cbio.mines-paristech.fr/graphm/. Coming soon to CRAN.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I taught an intersession course on R programming at Johns Hopkins. Here are my class notes: Letâ€™s first start Rstudio. This is a good GUI that helps you organize the R expressions(functions called with some arguments) you run, the plots and outputs as a result of those commands. We have four panes. The upper left is the R script file editor, where you will enter your commands and save them as a text file.
